results.name: Square array A(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of 1/sqrt(1 + 2*k*x + k*(k+4)*x^2).
formula: A(n,k) is the coefficient of x^n in the expansion of (1 - k*x - k*x^2)^n.
A(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..floor(n/2)} (-k)^(n-j) * binomial(n,j) * binomial(n-j,j) = Sum_{j=0..floor(n/2)} (-k)^(n-j) * binomial(n,2*j) * binomial(2*j,j).
mathematica: A[n_, k_] := (-k)^n*Hypergeometric2F1[(1-n)/2, -n/2, 1, -4/k]; A[0, _] = 1; A[_, 0] = 0; Table[A[n-k, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 07 2019 *)
